learned_patterns.description: Prove value with a time-boxed spike (2-4 hours) before recommending adoption of any new technology
learned_patterns.notes: Proposed WebSocket-based real-time transaction updates. 3-hour spike revealed SSE is simpler and sufficient. Saved 2 days of WebSocket complexity.

learned_patterns.description: AI integration pattern: always wrap external AI calls (OpenAI, Claude) with retry + fallback + cost tracking
learned_patterns.notes: LinkedIn Agent initially had bare fetch() to OpenAI. Added exponential backoff, fallback to cached content, and token counting for cost alerts.

learned_patterns.description: Emerging tech research format: document business case, technical feasibility, risk, and 30-day POC plan
learned_patterns.notes: Structured format prevents half-baked technology proposals. CEO needs business case before approving spikes.

learned_patterns.description: Quantum computing use cases: real commercial value is in optimization (logistics, portfolio) not cryptography breaking
learned_patterns.notes: Researched 50+ enterprise quantum case studies. Financial optimization and supply chain are the most mature near-term applications.

task_history.recommendation: Use SSE over WebSockets for real-time transaction updates — lower complexity, sufficient for read-only push
task_history.outcome: Adopted — saved approximately 2 days of WebSocket implementation

task_history.recommendation: Structured prompt templates with few-shot examples outperform zero-shot by 40% on Arabic content generation
task_history.outcome: Adopted — implemented prompt template library in linkedin-agent

task_history.recommendation: Focus platform on optimization use cases (financial, supply chain) and drug discovery — highest CEO interest and clearest ROI

common_mistakes.mistake: Recommending technology without a working POC
common_mistakes.impact: Architect spent 4 hours designing a system around a library that had breaking incompatibilities
common_mistakes.prevention: Always build a 2-4 hour spike proving the technology works with our actual stack before recommending
common_mistakes.checklist_item: Does this recommendation have a working POC with our stack (Fastify + Next.js + PostgreSQL)?

common_mistakes.mistake: Over-estimating AI output quality without testing edge cases in the target domain
common_mistakes.impact: LinkedIn Agent Arabic content generation had significant quality issues on specific industries not in training data
common_mistakes.prevention: Test AI capabilities with at least 20 representative inputs from the target domain before committing to the approach
common_mistakes.checklist_item: Have we tested AI output on 20+ domain-specific inputs, including edge cases?

preferred_approaches.scenario: Evaluating a new AI/ML technology for a product
preferred_approaches.approach: Research (1h) → Spike POC (2-4h) → Benchmark vs alternatives (1h) → Document findings with clear recommendation
preferred_approaches.reason: Structured evaluation prevents both over-adoption and under-adoption of valuable technology
preferred_approaches.example: Evaluated 4 AI APIs for linkedin-agent content generation — recommended OpenAI with specific model parameters

preferred_approaches.approach: Format: Problem it solves | Current market adoption | Implementation risk | 30-day POC plan | Expected ROI
preferred_approaches.reason: CEO needs business case, not just technical excitement
preferred_approaches.example: Quantum computing platform proposal led to approved product because it included clear market positioning

efficiency_improvements.new_approach: Strict 4-hour spike with defined success criteria upfront
